statements: UPSERT INTO security_table (id, username, password) VALUES (1, 'john.doe', 'password123')
UPSERT INTO security_table (id, username, password) VALUES (2, 'jane.smith', 'securepass456')
UPSERT INTO security_table (id, username, password) VALUES (3, 'admin', 'admin@123')
UPSERT INTO users (user_id, username, password) VALUES (1, 'john_doe', 'password123')
UPSERT INTO users (user_id, username, password) VALUES (2, 'jane_smith', 'securepwd')
INSERT INTO users (id, username, password) VALUES (1, 'john_doe', 'password123') ON CONFLICT (id) DO UPDATE SET username = 'john_doe', password = 'password123';
INSERT INTO users (id, username, password) VALUES (2, 'jane_smith', 'password456') ON CONFLICT (id) DO UPDATE SET username = 'jane_smith', password = 'password456';
INSERT INTO users (id, username, password) VALUES (3, 'alex_jones', 'password789') ON CONFLICT (id) DO UPDATE SET username = 'alex_jones', password = 'password789';
UPSERT INTO users (id, username, password) VALUES (1, 'john_doe', 'password123')

UPSERT INTO users (user_id, username, password) VALUES ('123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000', 'john_doe', 'password123') ON CONFLICT (user_id) DO UPDATE SET username = 'john_smith', password = 'new_password';
UPSERT INTO roles (role_id, role_name) VALUES ('223e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000', 'admin') ON CONFLICT (role_id) DO UPDATE SET role_name = 'super_admin';
UPSERT INTO permissions (permission_id, permission_name) VALUES ('323e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000', 'read') ON CONFLICT (permission_id) DO UPDATE SET permission_name = 'write';
